meanings.definition: Stand, move, or sit in a lazy, drooping way.
meanings.sent1: Tom tends to slouch when he's tired and needs to rest.
meanings.sent2: Don't slouch in your chair, sit up straight for better posture.
meanings.sent3: The sleepy cat would often slouch on the windowsill, looking out lazily.
meanings.sent4: Her spirits seemed to slouch like a wilting flower in the scorching sun.
meanings.sent5: The old tree appeared to slouch under the weight of the heavy snow, bending gracefully.

meanings.definition: A lazy or drooping posture or movement.
meanings.sent1: His constant slouch made him appear uninterested in everything around him.
meanings.sent2: The teacher reminded the students to correct their slouch for a more confident appearance.
meanings.sent3: The slouch of the scarecrow in the field gave the birds a false sense of security.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds hung in the sky with a slouch, foretelling an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The weight of disappointment seemed to settle on her shoulders, causing a visible slouch.
